description: Proposed 20m high 5G telecoms installation: H3G street pole and additional equipment cabinets.
application_type_full: Prior Approval: Development for electronic communications network
decision_conditions: The proposed telecoms equipment by virtue of its siting and appearance would result in an incongruous addition to the streetscene that would be visually intrusive and create visual clutter that would not be in keeping with and detract from the character and appearance of the surrounding area, causing harm to the non designated heritage asset (the Kingston Hill/Coombe Hill Strategic Area of Special Character). The benefits of the proposal would not outweigh the disbenefits of the proposal. The proposal would not accord with the NPPF 2023 and policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012 and Policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021.

The LPA is not satisfied that the applicant has fully considered alternative sites or that the application site represents the least harmful option available in the area to meet the additional coverage and capacity requirements. As such, the proposal is contrary to paragraph 117 of the NPPF 2023.

The proposed telecoms development would be in close proximity to a number of street trees and the applicant has not demonstrated that the proposed development would not have an adverse impact on these street trees. Reason: To safeguard trees worthy of retention and in the interests of the character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policy G7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
